page.title: 10Churches.N.Runcton,Middleton
page.content: Both villages now have only small regular congregations and both experience financial difficulties with the upkeep of their churches. At Middleton the main short term problem is that of bats living in the church roof. The only other urgent need is some re-pointing of the steeple. The church at North Runcton is most unusual being the work of Henry Bell in the 17th century and not the customary medieval building. We spoke to one of the two{churchwardens}who are resposible for the upkeep of the church. We were impressed by the high standard of maintenance and decoration of the church interior and were surprised to learn that most of the money for this has to be raised locally.
